content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I received a command from the user to generate an image of an octopus with the prompt "Octopus". The image was saved to disk:/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/7fa46c26-0f90-40cf-bf0f-e54c17b5340a.jpg and the user commanded me to write the image to a file named octopus_image.jpg. The command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully. The user also wrote the website URL to a file named octopus_urls.txt. When the user commanded me to read the file octopus_urls.txt, I returned the URL https://www.nhm.ac.uk/discover/octopuses-keep-surprising-us-here-are-eight-examples-how.html. The user then commanded me to open the image file with the command {"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "xdg-open octopus_image.jpg"}}}. Command execute_shell returned an error, stating that no method was available for opening \'octopus_image.jpg\'. I received a new command from the user to open the image file with the command {"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "feh octopus_image.jpg"}}}. Command execute_shell returned an error, stating that the program \'feh\' was not found. As the latest development, the user commanded me to open the image file with the command {"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "eog octopus_image.jpg"}}}.'}
"""

Latest Development:

[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb''\nSTDERR:\nb'Unable to init server: Could not connect: Connection refused\\n\\n(eog:806): Gtk-WARNING **: 08:38:06.764: cannot open display: \\n'"}, {'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "list_files", "args": {"directory": "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Failure: command list_files returned too much output.                         Do not execute this command again with the same arguments.'}]
